This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"addSupportedAsset(address)":{"details":"Add a supported If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. params.to: The address to receive the rewards

constructor.details: Constructor to set vault address and basic info

params.asset: The address of the asset to deposit

executeStrategy(uint256,bytes).details: Execute a strategy operation (must be implemented by derived contracts)

params.actionId: The identifier of the action to perform

returns.success: Indicates whether the operation was successful

getPerformanceMetrics().details: Get the current performance metrics of the strategy

returns.apy: The current APY (annual percentage yield) in basis points
returns.risk: Risk score from 1-5 (1 being the safest)
returns.tvl: Total value locked in the strategy

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

returns._0: name The name of the strategy
returns._1: description The description of the strategy
returns._2: version The version of the strategy
returns._3: supportedAssets Array of supported asset addresses

grantAgentRole(address).details: Grant agent role to an address

params.agent: The address to grant agent role

grantGuardianRole(address).details: Grant guardian role to an address

params.guardian: The address to grant guardian role

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeAgentRole(address).details: Revoke agent role from an address

params.agent: The address to revoke agent role

revokeGuardianRole(address).details: Revoke guardian role from an address

params.guardian: The address to revoke guardian role

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

validateAction(uint256,bytes).details: Check if an action is valid for execution

returns.isValid: Whether the action can be executed with the given parameters
returns.reason: Reason if the action is invalid

params.asset: The address of the asset to withdraw
